DataElement.preferredName: RT Beam Collimator DICOM Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) sets.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation._Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: A diaphragm or system of diaphragms made of an absorbing material, designed to define and restrict the dimensions and direction of a beam of radiation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  11/20/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ReferenceDocuments.description: One or more items shall be included in this sequence.
